summary: Email correspondence from Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team to a federal prosecutor complaining about Maxwell's treatment at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in Brooklyn. The email alleges inaccurate information from MDC legal counsel regarding restrictions on Maxwell's movement in her isolation cell, issues with food, and technical problems accessing discovery materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email; her legal team is complaining about her treatment and conditions while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

events.title: Guards impose movement restrictions on Maxwell
events.description: Guards at MDC instructed Ghislaine Maxwell not to stand on corners of her isolation cell, not to stand to the left or right of the toilet and sink, and not to stand within 2.5 feet of the cell door, threatening disciplinary sanctions for non-compliance.

locations: Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC), Brooklyn, New York
Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Law Offices of [redacted], West 19th Street, New York, NY 10011
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team alleges MDC legal counsel provided inaccurate information about her treatment in custody.
On December 29, 2020, Maxwell was reportedly given specific, restrictive directives on where she could stand in her isolation cell, contrary to prior assurances.
Maxwell's legal team reports she is not receiving the food designated on her menu.
The discovery disc provided to the defense does not work on the MDC computer, creating an access-to-evidence issue.
The correspondence highlights tensions between Maxwell's defense and prison authorities regarding her conditions of confinement while awaiting trial.
